page.title: 05INDUSTRY AT SANDHEAD
page.content: The major industry in the immediate vicinity of Sandhead is Dairy Farming. The rearing and nurturing of valuable animals, (milk factories on the hoof), is a highly skilled as well as an intuitive job that earns a good man a high wage. The largest proportion of land in our Block is under intense cultivation to support fairly intensive animal stocking in terms of heads per acre. Most farmers favour the cultivation of grass for silage, (it is cut green and harvested at least twice), because it is not so dependent upon the need for fine weather to produce a quality crop. Crops like turnips and kale are grown to be used as fodder in the field as the animals strip graze under control of an electrified fence. Some cereals are produced as rotational crops which provide straw and food.
